inclusion.criterion: Histologically proven prostate adenocarcinoma confirmed by a CLIA certified laboratory.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Prostate cancer with high risk features defined as: Gleason 8 and higher OR PSA > 20 ng/mL OR Clinical stage T3a (i.e. likely extraprostatic extension on MRI) or T3b.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Age greater than or equal to 18 years.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Adequate organ and marrow function as defined below: Hemoglobin greater than or equal to 9 g/dL, leukocytes greater than or equal to 3,000/mcL, platelets greater than or equal to 100,000/mcL.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Ability of subject to understand and the willingness to sign a written informed consent document.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Willingness and ability to undergo biopsy of radiotracer-avid lesion if feasible.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Willingness and ability to undergo multiparametric prostate MRI and 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Any investigational agents in the past 28 days prior to enrollment.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Clinical stage T4 (tumor invades adjacent structures except seminal vesicles).
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Distant metastatic disease on conventional imaging studies (computed tomography (CT) of the abdomen and pelvis and 99mTc-methylene diphosphonate bone scan (bone scan)).
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any prior hormone therapy used to treat prostate cancer, except limited androgen receptor antagonist therapy, defined as less than or equal to 3 days of treatment.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any prior therapy for prostate cancer with surgery, radiation, and/or chemotherapy.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has a history of lower urinary tract symptoms including frequency, urgency, weak stream, incomplete emptying and intermittent flow. He is otherwise healthy and has normal blood chemistry.
